title: Strategic Management - Capstone Project
description: In this capstone project course, we revisit the strategy controversy at e-Types, introduced in the first course in this specialization, Strategic Management, and further analysed in each of the subsequent courses, Strategy Formulation and Strategy Implementation. After revealing, examining, and analyzing what happened at e-Types, we turn to a new set of strategy cases that range in terms of company size, geography, and focus. For your final project, we ask YOU to apply everything you have learned in this specialization to analyze your choice of one of these four situations.
prerequisites: Completion of Strategic Management specialization courses (Strategic Management, Strategy Formulation, Strategy Implementation)
Basic understanding of business strategy concepts
learning_outcomes: Apply strategic management principles to analyze real-world business cases. Develop critical thinking and decision-making skills in the context of strategic challenges. Understand strategy formulation and implementation processes.
price: Free to audit, paid for certificate

title: Financial Management Capstone
description: The Financial Management capstone will provide a learning experience that integrates across all the courses within this specialization. You will analyze a situation taking the vantage point of a company and develop a financial management plan (for instance, a global company working in a specific geography chosen by students’ region or country of residence, or other consideration). You will design a deliverable to create value from the perspective of potential employers while achieving pedagogical and experiential goals.
prerequisites: Completion of introductory financial management courses or equivalent knowledge.
Basic understanding of financial statements and investment principles.
Familiarity with business strategy and analysis.
learning_outcomes: Develop a comprehensive financial management plan from a company's perspective. Analyze financial situations and create value for potential employers. Integrate knowledge from prior financial management coursework to achieve experiential goals.
price: Coursera offers courses for free and with a fee, price may vary.

title: Planet Earth: Understanding and Protecting our Environment
description: Learn about the physical geography of Earth and discover how to use this knowledge to protect our natural environment.
learning_outcomes: Understand Earth's physical geography and learn how to apply this knowledge to protect our natural environment. Explore sustainable practices and contribute to environmental conservation efforts.

title: Intermediate German: Countries and Landscapes
description: Examine the human and physical geography of German-speaking countries and the language used to discuss them.

learning_outcomes: Understand the human and physical geography of German-speaking countries. Enhance vocabulary related to geography and landscapes. Improve ability to discuss geographical topics in German.
